thread.title: BewhY To Collaborate With U.S. Rapper Big K.R.I.T | Soompi
thread.title_full: BewhY To Collaborate With U.S. Rapper Big K.R.I.T | Soompi

author: C. Hong
title: BewhY To Collaborate With U.S. Rapper Big K.R.I.T | Soompi
text:
Pin Display.Sharethrough.Soompi.1x1 
One of Korea’s hottest rappers, BewhY, will be releasing a collaboration track with U.S. rapper Big K.R.I.T! 
On February 28 KST, MNC Records, who is starting a project called “Super Collaboration,” stated, “The first stage of our project will begin on March 10 with BewhY and Big K.R.I.T’s collaboration track.” 
Big K.R.I.T is from the southern United States and was previously signed to the big label Def Jam Records. He is known for moving beyond the often-seen trap genre and instead combining 90’s Southern hip-hop with a more modern sound. 
The Super Collaboration project is a major production between Korea and the United States. BewhY, who won the Mnet survival program “Show Me the Money 5,” was recommended to Big K.R.I.T and MNC Records (a publisher and agency in various countries such as the United States, Japan, and China) by their partner company, Sky Infinity Group. 
BewhY has also previously named Big K.R.I.T as one of his role models. Through MNC Records, he released a statement saying, “It was an honor and a dream to be able to work with an artist that I’d admired since I started rapping. I had more fun than I’ve ever had working on the project and will work hard to make the finished product even better.”
